mflorea - (15:14): guys, is there a way to specify the -Xmx for the xwiki-packager-plugin? I'm getting java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space with a large xar. Maven has -Xmx1024m  
sdumitriu - (15:16): Better look at the plugin documentation  
sdumitriu - (15:16): Ah, it's our plugin  
mflorea - (15:16): yep :)  
sdumitriu - (15:17): So there's no documentation  
mflorea - (15:17): I'd have to look through the code  
tmortagne - (15:20): the best would probably be to improve the plugin to not load the entire package before saving it  
mflorea - (15:21): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-tools/trunk/xwiki-packager-plugin/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/tool/backup/ImportMojo.java nothing useful in the mojo. But, is the packager plugin executed in a forked process or in the same process as maven?  
tmortagne - (15:21): should be the same process as maven  
mflorea - (15:22): then it should inherit the -Xmx from maven process  
tmortagne - (15:22): yes i think it should  
mflorea - (15:22): the xar has 6.5MB  
mflorea - (15:22): 1024MB should be enough..  
mflorea - (15:23): -Xmx1024m  
tmortagne - (15:23): Iyes it should probablt be enough  
tmortagne - (15:23): try 2048 just to see if that change anything but it sound too much to me  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:33): you could run top and look at the java process to see if it's really running up to 1024m before bombing out.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:33): My gesss is it's not.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:33): guess  
mflorea - (15:35): the system has 2048MB RAM.. I tried with 1300 and still the same problem. Before failing with out of memory, this error is logged:  
mflorea - (15:37): http://pastebin.com/PgZ4xYjt  
florinciu left at 15:41 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:42  
ldubost joined #xwiki at 15:47  
ldubost2 joined #xwiki at 15:48  
ldubost left at 15:48 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
mflorea - (15:52): Problem solved, the -Xmx setting was not taken into account. Thanks Caleb for your hint!  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:53): Add the xmx to the pom file?  
mflorea - (15:54): no, in the mvn script :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:00): Hmm, I don't know much about maven, I guessed the problem because I had spent some time debugging the leak in the core unit tests.  
Ciprian left #xwiki at 16:50  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:53): Anyone know why I can be allowed to edit a page but not import it, and view but not export?  
sdumitriu - (16:54): Export gives access to confidential information (password hashes)  
sdumitriu - (16:54): Import can keep the author information, thus importing with programming rights  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:55): AFAIK import only keeps author info it the wiki is empty or the user has PR, right?  
evalica left at 16:59 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (17:01): Yes  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:02): Anyway I have a greasemonkey script for importing a class when you aren't allowed to import, just paste in the xml content and hit save.  
tmortagne - (17:02): CalebJamesDeLisl: practical reason is that there is a if on admin right in the packager plugin  
tmortagne - (17:03): which is wrong IMO  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:05): Another question that I've been wondering about is why can't a malicious user deny everyone access to their user page preventing admins from deleting it?  
sdumitriu - (17:06): Admin rights always win  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:07): I see so admin == (view + edit + delete + undelete) undeniable at a lower level.

sdumitriu - (23:00): Shouldn't the DocumentReference class override equals/hashcode?  
npm left at 23:00 (Quit: Leaving.

sdumitriu - (23:02): a reference's parent is not a parent in the document meaning
